newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan's Central Bank offers 15 mln dinars in CDs.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's Central Bank offers 15 mln dinars in CDs.

text.p: The Central Bank of Jordan said on Sunday it was offering banks 15 million dinars in certificates of deposits (CDs) in this week's auction.
Interest yields released on Sunday from last week's auction were unchanged at 9.250 percent for three-month papers and 9.500 percent for six-months.
Repurchase agreements as collatoral to weekly CDs remained at 10 percent with an unchanged 8.5 percent discount rate.
Outstanding CDs fell to 522.1 million dinars ($737 million) from 527.7 million dinars last week.

The Central Bank is maintaining a high interest rate policy to preserve the attractiveness of dinar-denominated assets and curb any excessive outflow of dinars into dollar-denominated assets that could erode its foreign currency reserves.
